Package gov.nih.nlm.ling.core

Class Document

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nih.nlm.ling.core.Document
  • public class Document
extends java.lang.Object
    The representation of a basic document, consisting of sentences.

    The semantic objects, such as terms and relations, are tracked at the document level. A document may also have been segmented into sections. This class includes a SurfaceElementFactory object used to instantiate textual units and a SemanticItemFactory to instantiate semantic objects.

    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu

      • Document

        public Document​(java.lang.String id,
                java.lang.String text)
        Creates a Document object from a piece of text.
        Parameters:
        id - the identifier
        text - the text of the document

      • Document

        public Document​(java.lang.String id,
                java.lang.String text,
                java.util.List<Sentence> sentences)
        Creates a Document object from a list of sentences.
        Parameters:
        id - the identifier
        text - the text of the document
        sentences - the list of sentences, ordered by character offsets

      • Document

        public Document​(java.lang.String id,
                java.lang.String text,
                java.util.List<Sentence> sentences,
                edu.stanford.nlp.trees.Tree documentTree)
        Creates a Document object with the full parse tree.
        Parameters:
        id - the identifier
        text - the text of the document
        sentences - the list of sentences, ordered by character offsets
        documentTree - the parse trees of the sentences combined

      • Document

        public Document​(java.lang.String id,
                java.lang.String text,
                java.util.List<Sentence> sentences,
                edu.stanford.nlp.trees.Tree documentTree,
                java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<? extends SemanticItem>,java.util.LinkedHashSet<SemanticItem>> semanticItems)
        Creates a Document object with semantic objects.

        Semantic objects are specified as key/value pairs, where the key is the class of semantic object (Entity, Predicate, etc.) and the value is the set of semantic objects belonging to that type in the document.

        Parameters:
        id - the identifier
        text - the text of the document
        sentences - the list of sentences, ordered by character offsets
        documentTree - the parse trees of the sentences combined
        semanticItems - a Map of semantic objects.

      • Document

        public Document​(nu.xom.Element el)
        Creates aDocument from an XML element.

        The lexical and syntactic information is parsed, but not semantic annotations.

        Parameters:
        el - the XML element corresponding to this document

      • Document

        public Document​(nu.xom.Element el,
                java.lang.String tokenizer,
                java.lang.String parser)
        Similar to #Document(Element), but allows selecting a particular tokenizer/parser output for syntactic analysis of the sentence.
        Parameters:
        el - the XML element corresponding to this document
        tokenizer - the tokenizer name
        parser - the parser name

      • setSemanticItemFactory

        public void setSemanticItemFactory​(SemanticItemFactory sif)
        Sets the semantic item factory for this document.

        This can be used when a class that extends the generic SemanticItemFactory needs to be create new types of semantic items.

        Parameters:
        sif - a semantic item factory

      • getAllSurfaceElements

        public java.util.List<SurfaceElement> getAllSurfaceElements()
        Gets all textual units of this document.
        Returns:
        the list of all textual units of this document in the order they appear.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the document has not been split into sentences already.

      • addSemanticItems

        Parameters:

      • removeAllSemantics

        public void removeAllSemantics()
        Removes all semantics associated with this document and resets the underlying sentences (i.e., remove the multi-word expression information).

      • removeSemanticItem

        public void removeSemanticItem​(SemanticItem semanticItem)
        Removes a single semantic item as well as the associated semantic items from this document.

        For example, if a Predicate is being removed, all the Relations associated with it are also removed. The textual units associated with the removed semantic items are updated as well.

        Parameters:
        semanticItem - the semantic item to remove from this document

      • getMaxId

        public int getMaxId​(java.lang.Class<? extends SemanticItem> clazz)
        For a given semantic class (or its subclasses), finds the max id in this document so that the counter can be updated accordingly. It assumes that ids have the format [A-Z][0-9]+ where the second half is the id. Returns 0 if there are no semantic items of the given semantic class.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the semantic class
        Returns:
        the max id

      • getSemanticItemById

        public SemanticItem getSemanticItemById​(java.lang.String semId)
        Gets the semantic object with the given id. Returns null if no semantic item with the given id is found.
        Parameters:
        semId - the identifier
        Returns:
        the semantic object with the given id

      • getSemanticItemsByClass

        public static java.util.LinkedHashSet<SemanticItem> getSemanticItemsByClass​(Document doc,
                                                                            java.lang.Class<? extends SemanticItem> clazz)
        Gets semantic items associated with a semantic class (Entity, Event, etc.).

        If the class name provided is an interface or superclass name, it attempts to identify the implementing/extending classes and the instances belonging to these classes. For example, it will return both Entity and Predicate objects when the class name provided is Term.

        Parameters:
        doc - the document with the semantic items
        clazz - the semantic class name
        Returns:
        the set of semantic items of the given class, empty set if there are none or if the key is invalid

      • getSemanticItemsByClassSpan

        public static java.util.LinkedHashSet<SemanticItem> getSemanticItemsByClassSpan​(Document doc,
                                                                                java.lang.Class<? extends SemanticItem> clazz,
                                                                                SpanList sp,
                                                                                boolean allowOverlap)
        Finds all semantic items of a given semantic class in a given text span.

        A specialization of getSemanticItemsByClass(Document, Class). For Relation objects, it will only consider those whose arguments and predicate, if any, fall within the span.

        Parameters:
        doc - the document with the semantic items
        clazz - the semantic class
        sp - the text span subsuming the semantic items
        allowOverlap - whether to include the semantic items that only overlap with the text span and are not subsumed by it
        Returns:
        the semantic items in the given span, empty set if no semantic objects with the given class

      • getSemanticItemsByClassType

        public static java.util.LinkedHashSet<SemanticItem> getSemanticItemsByClassType​(Document doc,
                                                                                java.lang.Class<? extends SemanticItem> key,
                                                                                java.util.List<java.lang.String> types)
        Finds all semantic items of a given semantic class and a given list of semantic types.

        A specialization of getSemanticItemsByClass(Document, Class).

        Parameters:
        doc - the document with the semantic items
        key - the semantic class
        types - a list of semantic types
        Returns:
        the semantic items of the given class and semantic types

      • getSemanticItemsByClassTypeSpan

        public static java.util.LinkedHashSet<SemanticItem> getSemanticItemsByClassTypeSpan​(Document doc,
                                                                                    java.lang.Class<? extends SemanticItem> clazz,
                                                                                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> types,
                                                                                    SpanList sp,
                                                                                    boolean allowOverlap)
        Similar to getSemanticItemsByClassType(Document, Class, List), but also filters by text span and may allow overlap.
        Parameters:
        doc - the document to query
        clazz - the semantic object class
        types - the semantic types
        sp - the span to query
        allowOverlap - whether span overlap is allowed
        Returns:
        the semantic items with the given class/semantic types within a span

      • getSemanticItemsBySpan

        public static java.util.LinkedHashSet<SemanticItem> getSemanticItemsBySpan​(Document doc,
                                                                           SpanList sp,
                                                                           boolean allowOverlap)
        Finds all semantic items, regardless of class, within a text span.

        For Relation objects, it will only consider those whose arguments and predicate, if any, fall within the span.

        Parameters:
        doc - the document to query
        sp - the span to query
        allowOverlap - whether to allow overlap with the text span
        Returns:
        all semantic items within a given span

        Parameters:

        predicate - the predicate
        Returns:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getOntologyTerms

        public java.util.Map<Ontology,java.util.LinkedHashSet<SurfaceElement>> getOntologyTerms()
        Groups all textual units by the concepts they map to
        Returns:
        a map of concept/textual units key/value pairs

      • getOntologyTerms

        public java.util.Map<Ontology,java.util.LinkedHashSet<SurfaceElement>> getOntologyTerms​(java.lang.Class<? extends SemanticItem> clazz)
        Finds all the conceptually equivalent textual units within the document. This method only considers a specific semantic class.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the semantic item class
        Returns:
        a map of concept/textual units for the given semantic item class

      • getOntologyMatches

        public static java.util.LinkedHashSet<SurfaceElement> getOntologyMatches​(Document doc,
                                                                         SurfaceElement surf)
        Given a textual unit, finds all conceptually equivalent textual units within the document
        Parameters:
        doc - the document of the textual unit
        surf - the input textual unit
        Returns:
        the textual units within the document that map to the same concept, null if the textual unit has no semantics

      • getOntologyMatches

        public static java.util.LinkedHashSet<SemanticItem> getOntologyMatches​(Document doc,
                                                                       SemanticItem sem)
        Given a semantic item, finds all conceptually equivalent semantic items within the document
        Parameters:
        doc - the document of the semantic item
        sem - the input semantic item
        Returns:
        the semantic items within the document that are normalized to the same concept

      • linearDistance

        public int linearDistance​(SurfaceElement s1,
                          SurfaceElement s2)
        Calculates the distance of two textual units within this document.
        Parameters:
        s1 - the first textual unit
        s2 - the second textual unit
        Returns:
        the distance between the textual units
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the sentences are not known

      • getSubsumingSentence

        public Sentence getSubsumingSentence​(Span sp)
        Gets the first sentence that subsumes the given span.

        If the span partially overlaps with the sentence, the sentence is still returned.

        Parameters:
        sp - the span of the text
        Returns:
        the sentence that subsumes/overlaps with the span, or null if the document length is smaller than the given span
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the sentences are not known

      • getAllSubsumingSentences

        public java.util.List<Sentence> getAllSubsumingSentences​(Span sp)
        Gets all the sentences that are subsumed by the given span.

        If the span partially overlaps with the sentence, the sentence is still returned.

        Parameters:
        sp - the span of the text
        Returns:
        the list of sentences that are subsumed by or overlaps with the span, or an empty list
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the sentences are not known

      • getSurfaceElementsInSpan

        public java.util.List<SurfaceElement> getSurfaceElementsInSpan​(Span sp)
        Gets the textual units in a given span.
        Parameters:
        sp - the span
        Returns:
        the list of textual units in the span
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the sentences are not known

        Parameters:

      • getStringInSpan

        public java.lang.String getStringInSpan​(Span sp)
        Gets the text within a given span of this document.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the text in the span
        Throws:

      • getStringInSpan

        public java.lang.String getStringInSpan​(SpanList sp)
        Similar to #getStringInSpan(Span), but takes a span list as an argument.

        The texts will be delimited by SpanList#SEPARATOR.

        Parameters:
        sp - the span of the text
        Returns:
        the text in the span

      • getInterveningWords

        public java.util.List<Word> getInterveningWords​(SurfaceElement a,
                                                SurfaceElement b)
        Gets the individual tokens intervening between two textual units. The order of the textual units in text is not important.
        Parameters:
        a - the first textual unit
        b - the second textual unit
        Returns:
        the list of tokens between the textual units, or empty list if they are adjacent

      • getInterveningSurfaceElements

        public java.util.List<SurfaceElement> getInterveningSurfaceElements​(SurfaceElement a,
                                                                    SurfaceElement b)
        Similar to #getInterveningWords(SurfaceElement, SurfaceElement), but will get a list of textual units, rather than individual tokens.
        Parameters:
        a - the first textual unit
        b - the second textual unit
        Returns:
        the list of tokens between the textual units, or empty list if they are adjacent

      • getSection

        public Section getSection​(Sentence sentence)
        Finds the section that a sentence appears in.
        Parameters:
        sentence - the sentence in question
        Returns:
        the section of the sentence, or null if the document has no sections or the section cannot be identified

      • toXml

        public nu.xom.Element toXml()
        Returns the XML representation of this document.

        Semantic items are children of the document node, independent of sentences.

        Returns:
        the XML representation

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
